ygData.subject: Re: Fwd: Re: [EQ-Spoilers] Solusek's Eye
ygData.msgSnippet: I m level 11 and I ve made a couple thousand without twinking of any kind :) All depends on what you have your character do for a living. My productivity is
ygData.messageBody:
I'm level 11 and I've made a couple thousand without twinking of any kind :) All depends
on what you have your character do for a living. My productivity is constantly
increasing, so several hundred plat has become almost commonplace to me. A thousand is
pricy, but not unheard of. 8000 would take saving up for and really not be worth it, but
if I had nothing else to spend it on, I might go for it.
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

Mad Grizzle wrote:

> From: Mad Grizzle <MadGrizzle@...>
>
> BUT 8000pp! Geez. where do you get the money? Ive never broken 100pp and I'm level
> 26.
>
> Nosferatu wrote:
>
> > From: Nosferatu <nosferatu@...>
> >
> > Or any and all mage types would really love to hear about this item, my
> > str is naturally a astounding 61, which means I cant carry didly squat,
> > now if I can hold some really heavy stuff nearly weightlessly, heck I
> > might not have to ditch everything less than a gold piece when in a
> > dungeon!
> > /Nosferatu
> >
> > Nick Emmerich wrote:
> > >
> > > From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> > >
> > > might not be worth 8000pp to you, but try asking a level 30 monk :) He might be
> > > rather interested in something to keep his weight down VERY efficiently :)
> > > -Rennin of E'Ci
> > > Trade Council GM
> > >
> > > MadGrizzle wrote:
> > >
> > > > From: MadGrizzle <MadGrizzle@...>
> > > >
> > > > Bad news, apparently the 'Bag of the Tinkerers' is a backpack that has 10
> > > > slots with 100% weight reduction. That isn't worth 8000 pp to me! If we
> > > > could make one it'll likely cost us 13000pp to produce (compass). Or it'll
> > > > cost 3000pp to make and then not work (cams). Nonetheless, you won't get
> > > > any experience from it because you'd get the tattered backpack back on a
> > > > failed attempt.
> > > >
> > > > Anyway, no luck yet on the other books.
> > > >
